summary: This document is a series of internal email exchanges among U.S. Attorney's Office (USANYS) personnel and contractors in March 2020, discussing work-from-home arrangements and case management during the COVID-19 pandemic. One email specifically mentions an expectation to send a draft SW (search warrant) in the Epstein case, indicating ongoing investigative activity.

persons.name: Geoff
persons.context: Mentioned as the sender of an important email regarding work-from-home policies and whose instructions are emphasized as mandatory for the team.

events.title: Draft Search Warrant in Epstein Case
events.description: An email states the sender expects to send a draft SW (search warrant) in the Epstein case this week.

events.title: COVID-19 Work-From-Home Transition
events.description: Multiple emails detail the team's transition to working from home due to the COVID-19 pandemic, school closures, and a colleague awaiting test results.

keyFacts: A draft search warrant (SW) in the Epstein case was expected to be sent in late March 2020, indicating active investigative steps were being planned.
The communications are internal emails among personnel from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) and contractors.
The context is the early COVID-19 pandemic lockdown period, with the team managing cases remotely and planning virtual social events.
All personal names except 'Geoff' are redacted with placeholders like (USANYS) or [Contractor], and specific case details are not disclosed.
